Version: @(#)regtc1793.xml 1.9 10/11/30 Generated by @(#)XmlSfrfilePrinter.java 1.19 10/11/04
This file contains all SFR and BIT names and on-chip register definitions It is based on the following document(s): - mira/TC1798_UM_V1.0_20101124.xml (UM V1.0, 24.11.2010)
Copyright 2002-2010 Altium BV

The entire PRAM is protected against FPI writes.
0 Bytes (i.e. there is no Protected Window; the entire PRAM (subject to PRAM Partitioning) can be written by the use of PRAM write instructions by any Channel).
256 Bytes (i.e. the lowest 64 words of PRAM are protected against PRAM write instructions executed by non-protected Channels).
255 * 256 Bytes

The Channel with the number defined by PPROT.PTHRES is the highest Channel Program that is treated as protected. All Channel?s with numbers below the value of PPROT.PTHRES are also treated as protected.

The Channel with the number defined by PPROT.PTHRES is the lowest Channel program that is treated as protected. All Channel?s with numbers above the value of PPROT.PTHRES are also treated as protected.

bitfield.name: ENI
bitfield.description: PRAM Protection Enable for Internal Writes

value.description: The entire PRAM (subject to PRAM partitioning) is not protected and can be written using PCP PRAM write instructions.

All PRAM outside the Protected Window (and subject to PRAM partitioning) is not protected and can be written using PCP PRAM write instructions. PRAM inside the Protected Window remains writable using PCP PRAM write instructions only by a protected channel (subject to PRAM partitioning).

bitfield.name: EN
bitfield.description: PRAM Protection Enable for FPI Writes

value.description: PRAM is not protected and can be written via FPI at any time.
All PRAM outside the Open Window is protected and can not be written via FPI. PRAM inside the Open Window remains writable via FPI.
Registers are not protected and can be written at any time.
Registers are protected and can only be written when ENDINT is ?0?.

DMA channel 0n is disabled for Soft-suspend Mode. The DMA channel 0n does not react on an active suspend request signal SUSREQ.
DMA channel 0n is enabled for Soft-suspend Mode. If the suspend request signal SUSREQ becomes active, a DMA transaction of DMA channel 0n is stopped after the current DMA transfer has been finished

bitfield.name: HTRE00
bitfield.description: Hardware Transaction Request Enable State of DMA Channel 0n

value.description: Hardware transaction request for DMA Channel 0n is disabled. An input DMA request will not trigger the channel 0n.
Hardware transaction request for DMA Channel 0n is enabled. The transfers of a DMA transaction are controlled by the corresponding channel request line of the DMA requesting source.

Shadow address register not used. Source and destination address register are written directly
Shadow address register used for source address buffering. When writing to SADR0x, the address is buffered in SHADR0x and transferred to SADR0x with the start of the next SDMA transaction
Shadow address register used for destination address buffering. When writing to DADR0x, the address is buffered in SHADR0x and transferred to DADR0x with the start of the next SDMA transaction
Shadow address register is read only and the value stored in the SHADR0x is automatically set to 00000000H when the shadow transfer takes place
Shadow address register SHADR0x can be read and can be directly written. The value stored in the SHADR0x is not automatically modified when the shadow transfer takes place

TRSR.CH0n is reset after each transfer. A transfer request is required for each transfer.

Single Mode operation is selected for SDMA channel 0n. After a transaction, SDMA channel 0n is disabled for further hardware requests (TRSR.HTRE0n is reset by hardware) TRSR.HTRE0n must be set again by software for starting a new transaction.
Continuous Mode operation is selected for SDMA channel 0n. After a transaction, bit TRSR.HTRE0n remains set

SDMA channel 0n has a high channel priority

When QSMEN is written with 0, the state of bit SSOTC.EN is don?t care. In this case, the enable/disable of the SSC is controlled by bit CON.EN only. Note that EN should only be cleared by software while no transfer is in progress (STAT.BSY = 0).

When QSMEN is written with 0, the state of bit SSOTC.EN is don?t care. In this case, the enable/disable of the SSC is controlled by bit CON.EN only. Note that EN should only be cleared by software while no transfer is in progress (STAT.BSY = 0).
When QSMEN is written with 1, queued SSC mode is enabled, and the state of bit SSOTC.EN is copied to CON.EN.

bitfield.name: IDE
bitfield.description: Identifier Extension Bit of Message Object n

value.description: Message object n handles standard frames with 11-bit identifier.
Message object n handles extended frames with 29-bit identifier.

Time-Triggered CAN (TTCAN): The Message Object Mask Register specifies the position(s) within the transmission matrix at which the message object n may be transmitted. Transmit acceptance filtering is based on the list order. This means that message object n is considered for transmission only if there is no other message object with valid transmit request (MSGVAL 'and' TXEN0 'and' TXEN1=1) that matches the actual position within the transmission matrix somewhere before this object in the list.

Transmit acceptance filtering is based on the list order. This means that message object n is considered for transmission only if there is no other message object with valid transmit request (MSGVAL 'and' TXEN0 'and' TXEN1=1) somewhere before this object in the list.

Transmit acceptance filtering is based on the CAN identifier. This means, message object n is considered for transmission only if there is no other message object with higher priority identifier+IDE+DIR (with respect to CAN arbitration rules) somewhere in the list (see ).
Transmit acceptance filtering is based on the list order (as PRI=01B).

Receive Object selected: With TXRQ=1, a Remote Frame with the identifier of message object n is scheduled for transmission. On reception of a Data Frame with matching identifier, the message is stored in message object n.

Resetting bit INIT enables the participation of the node in the CAN traffic. If the CAN node is in the bus-off state, the ongoing bus-off recovery (which does not depend on the INIT bit) is continued. With the end of the bus-off recovery sequence the CAN node is allowed to take part in the CAN traffic. If the CAN node is not in the bus-off state, a sequence of 11 consecutive recessive bits must be detected before the node is allowed to take part in the CAN traffic.

Setting this bit terminates the participation of this node in the CAN traffic. Any ongoing frame transfer is cancelled and the transmit line goes recessive. If the CAN node is in the bus-off state, then the running bus-off recovery sequence is continued. If the INIT bit is still set after the successful completion of the bus-off recovery sequence, i.e. after detecting 128 sequences of 11 consecutive recessive bits (11 ? 1), then the CAN node leaves the bus-off state but remains inactive as long as INIT remains set.

bitfield.name: CRZ
bitfield.description: CRC with Zero Nibble for Serial Data

value.description: Trailing zero nibble added in calculation, recommended by standard (default)
NO trailing zero nibble added in calculation, legacy mode by standard.
standard (16 frames, 4 bit ID, 8 bit data, 4 bit CRC)
extended (18 frames, 4 or 8 bit ID, 12 or 16 bit data, 6 bit CRC)
Drift Errors enabled (default)
Drift Errors disabled
An OCDS suspend trigger is ignored by this 32-bit SCU channel.

An OCDS suspend trigger disables the 32-bit SCU channel: As soon as the SPC sender logic of the 32-bit SCU channel becomes idle, the module is stopped while all registers of the channel stay readable. The receiver is stopped unconditionally. A partly received frame is discarded.
STOP Channel is disabled and can be configured
INITIALIZED Channel is configured and enabled and no Synchronization / Calibration Pulse was received since last enable.
RUNNING one or more Synchronization / Calibration Pulses were received and Frequency Range or Frequency Drift not or no longer in range. Fallback status from SYNCHRONIZED.
SYNCHRONIZED Frequency Range and Frequency Drift in range
Pulse length is 0 ticks
Pulse length is 1 tick
Pulse length is 63 ticks
No Pulse is generated, OFF When cleared, an ongoing transfer is stopped immediately and the transmit output is driven recessive.
Pulse starts immediately (no auto repetition)
Pulse starts each time the first falling edge of any Synchronization / Calibration Pulse is received (auto repetition on next Sync. / Cal. Pulses)
Pulse starts after each external trigger event. (auto repetition on next trigger) IOCRx.ETS selects the source of this event.
Pulse is not delayed
Pulse is delayed by 1 tick
Pulse is delayed by 63 ticks
Pulse is based on measured frequency of last Synchronization/Calibration Pulse
Pulse is based on nominal frequency

Cold starting of node enabled
Cold starting of node disabled
UNDEFINED. Wakeup not yet executed by the Communication Controller.
RECEIVED_HEADER. Set when the Communication Controller finishes wakeup due to the reception of a Frame Header without coding violation on either channel in ?WAKEUP_LISTEN? state.
RECEIVED_WUP. Set when the Communication Controller finishes wakeup due to the reception of a valid wakeup pattern on the configured wakeup channel in ?WAKEUP_LISTEN? state.
COLLISION_HEADER. Set when the Communication Controller stops wakeup due to a detected collision during wakeup pattern transmission by receiving a valid Header on either channel.
COLLISION_WUP. Set when the Communication Controller stops wakeup due to a detected collision during wakeup pattern transmission by receiving a valid wakeup pattern on the configured wakeup channel.

COLLISION_UNKNOWN. Set when the Communication Controller stops wakeup by leaving ?WAKEUP_DETECT? state after expiration of the wakeup timer without receiving a valid wakeup pattern or a valid Frame Header.
TRANSMITTED. Set when the Communication Controller has successfully completed the transmission of the wakeup pattern.

value.description: Compare uses normal sequence of local input data bus (YI) bits.
Compare uses reversed sequence of local input data bus (YI) bits.

bitfield.name: OSM
bitfield.description: One Shot Mode Enable for Shadow Register Copy

value.description: Shadow register copy is continuously enabled.
Shadow register copy is enabled for one event only.
Service request SQT63 is disabled.
Service request SQT63 is generated when a compare event has occurred.
Service request SQT63 is generated when a shadow register copy event has occurred.

bitfield.name: RED
bitfield.description: Rising Edge Select for Shadow Register Copy

value.description: Shadow register copy is not triggered by a rising edge on the LTC63IN input line.
Shadow register copy is triggered by a rising edge on the LTC63IN input line.

bitfield.name: FED
bitfield.description: Falling Edge Select for Shadow Register Copy

value.description: Shadow register copy is not triggered by a falling edge on the LTC63IN input line.
Shadow register copy is triggered by a falling edge on the LTC63IN input line.

bitfield.name: ILM
bitfield.description: Shadow Register Copy Input Line Mode

value.description: LTC63IN is operating in Edge Sensitive Mode.
LTC63IN is operating in Level Sensitive Mode.
Shadow register copy is currently disabled.
Shadow register copy is currently enabled.
LTC63OUT output line is 0.
LTC63OUT output line is 1.

bitfield.name: DCM00R
bitfield.description: DCMkk=0-3; k=0 refers to DCM00R, DCM00F, or DCM00C; k=1 refers to DCM01R, DCM01F, or DCM01C; k=2 refers to DCM02R, DCM02F, or DCM02C; k=3 refers to DCM03R, DCM03F, or DCM03C. Rising Edge Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.
Service is requested due to a rising edge detected on the DCMk input signal line.

bitfield.name: DCM00F
bitfield.description: DCMk Falling Edge Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.
Service is requested due to a falling edge detected on the DCMk input signal line.

bitfield.name: DCM00C
bitfield.description: DCMk Compare Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.
Service is requested due to a compare event occurred in DCMk cell (k=0-3).

bitfield.name: DCM01R
bitfield.description: DCMkk=0-3; k=0 refers to DCM00R, DCM00F, or DCM00C; k=1 refers to DCM01R, DCM01F, or DCM01C; k=2 refers to DCM02R, DCM02F, or DCM02C; k=3 refers to DCM03R, DCM03F, or DCM03C. Rising Edge Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.
Service is requested due to a rising edge detected on the DCMk input signal line.

bitfield.name: DCM01F
bitfield.description: DCMk Falling Edge Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.
Service is requested due to a falling edge detected on the DCMk input signal line.

bitfield.name: DCM01C
bitfield.description: DCMk Compare Event Service Request State

value.description: No service is requested.

value.description: LTCk operates in Capture Mode
LTCk operates in Compare Mode
LTCk operates in Free-Running Timer Mode
LTCk operates in reset Timer Mode
LTCk is continuously enabled
LTCk is enabled for one event only
Service request is disabled.
Service request SQSk is activated when a - capture event has occurred - compare event has occurred - timer overflow has happened depending on the operation mode selected by bit field MOD.
LTC Prescaler Mode is disabled
LTC Prescaler Mode with LTC prescaler clock LTCPRE is enabled
Input signal is active high
Input signal is active low
State of select line output SO is 0
State of select line output SO is 1
No effect
Coherent update disabled (bit CUD is cleared)
Input line is operating in Edge Sensitive Mode.
Input line is operating in Level Sensitive Mode.
Select output SO is not toggled on timer reset overflow
Select output SO is toggled on next timer reset overflow
LTCk is currently disabled for local events
LTCk is currently enabled for local events
Current state of LTCkOUT output line is hold
Current state of LTCkOUT output line is toggled by an internal LTCk event otherwise hold
LTCkOUT output line is forced to 0 by an internal LTCk event otherwise hold
LTCkOUT output line is forced to 1 by an internal LTCk event otherwise hold
LTCkOUT output line state is affected by an internal LTCk event and/or by an operation occurred in an adjacent LTCk cell (reported by M1I/M0I interface lines)
No immediate action required
Action defined by bit field OCM must be performed immediately
LTCkOUT output line is 0
LTCkOUT output line is 1
M3O/M2O lines are affected by M1I/M0I lines
M3O/M2O lines are affected by M3I/M2I lines
LTCk operates in Capture Mode.
LTCk operates in Compare Mode.
LTCk operates in Free-Running Timer Mode.
LTCk operates in reset Timer Mode.
LTCk is continuously enabled.
LTCk is enabled for one event only.
Service request is disabled.
Service request SQSk is activated when a - capture event has occurred - compare event has occurred - timer overflow has happened depending on the operation mode selected by bit field MOD.
Capture event is not triggered by a rising edge.
Capture event is triggered by a rising edge on the LTCkIN input line.
Capture event is not triggered by a falling edge.
Capture event is triggered by a falling edge on the LTCkIN input line.
M1O/M0O lines are affected either by M1I/M0I lines or by OCM1/OCM0 bits.
M1O/M0O lines are affected only by M1I/M0I (GBYP=0) or M2I/M2I (GBYP=1) lines.
LTCk is enabled for local events.
LTCk is disabled for local events. On an event on the communication link via M0I/M1I lines, EOA will be cleared and local events will be enabled.
Input line is operating in Edge Sensitive Mode.
Input line is operating in Level Sensitive Mode.

FIFO completely written (write access to MRADIN ignored). Must be re-enabled via WCRES before array can be re-initialized.

bitfield.description: Enable Interrupt for Correct Hall Event

value.description: No interrupt will be generated if the set condition for bit CHE in register IS occurs.

bitfield.name: ENWHE
bitfield.description: Enable Interrupt for Wrong Hall Event

value.description: No interrupt will be generated if the set condition for bit WHE in register IS occurs.
An interrupt will be generated if the set condition for bit WHE in register IS occurs. The service request output that will be activated is selected by bit field INPERR.
The bit IDLE is not automatically set when a wrong hall event is detected.
The bit IDLE is automatically set when a wrong hall event is detected.

bitfield.name: TRPS
bitfield.description: Trap StateDuring the trap state, the selected outputs are set to the passive state. The logic level driven during the passive state is defined by the corresponding bit in register PSLR. Bits TRPS=1 and TRPF=0 can occur if the trap condition is no longer active but the selected synchronization has not yet taken place.

The module is switched off immediately (without respecting a stop condition). It does not react on mode control actions and the module clock is switched off. The module does not react on read accesses and ignores write accesses (except to KSCFG).
The module is switched on and can operate. After writing 1 to MODEN, it is recommended to read register KSCFG to avoid pipeline effects in the control block before accessing other CCU6 registers.
MODEN is not changed.
MODEN is updated with the written value.
The acknowledge is not activated, because at least one of the module kernels is in a transition phase.
The acknowledge is activated, because all module kernels have reached the requested state.
A suspend mode is not requested and bit field NOMCFG defines the CCU6 kernel mode.
A suspend mode is requested and bit field SUMCFG defines the CCU6 kernel mode.
Run mode 0 is selected.
Run mode 1 is selected.
Stop mode 0 is selected.
Stop mode 1 is selected.
NOMCFG is not changed.
NOMCFG is updated with the written value.
SUMCFG is not changed.
SUMCFG is updated with the written value.
COMCFG is not changed.
COMCFG is updated with the written value.

Edge-aligned Mode: T12 always counts up and continues counting from zero after reaching the period value.
Center-aligned Mode: T12 counts down after detecting a period-match and counts up after detecting a one-match.

bitfield.name: T13R
bitfield.description: Timer T13 Run BitA concurrent set/cleared action on T13R (from T13SSC, T13TEC, T13RR or T13RS) will have no effect. The bit T12R will remain unchanged.

value.description: Timer T13 is stopped.
Timer T13 is running.
The shadow register transfer is disabled.
The shadow register transfer is enabled.
The single-shot mode is disabled, no HW action on T12R.

The single shot mode is enabled, the bit T12R is cleared by HW if - T12 reaches its period value in edge-aligned mode - T12 reaches the value 1 while down counting in center-aligned mode. In parallel to the clear action of bit T12R, the bits CC6xST (x=0, 1, 2) are cleared.
No HW action on T13R
The single-shot mode is enabled, the bit T13R is cleared by HW if T13 reaches its period value. In parallel to the clear action of bit T13R, the bit CC63ST is cleared.
no action
set T13R on a T12 compare event on channel 0
set T13R on a T12 compare event on channel 1
set T13R on a T12 compare event on channel 2
set T13R on any T12 compare event (ch. 0, 1, 2)
set T13R upon a period-match of T12
set T13R upon a zero-match of T12 (while counting up)
set T13R on any edge of inputs CCPOSx

bitfield.name: T13TED
bitfield.description: Timer T13 Trigger Event DirectionExample: If the timer T13 is intended to start at any compare event on T12 (T13TEC=100) the trigger event direction can be programmed to - counting up 'gt''gt' a T12 channel 0, 1, 2 compare match triggers T13R only while T12 is counting up - counting down 'gt''gt' a T12 channel 0, 1, 2 compare match triggers T13R only while T12 is counting down - independent from bit CDIR 'gt''gt' each T12 channel 0, 1, 2 compare match triggers T13R The timer count direction is taken from the value of bit CDIR. As a result, if T12 is running in edge-aligned mode (counting up only), T13 can only be started automatically if bit field T13TED=01 or 11.

value.description: reserved, no action
while T12 is counting up
while T12 is counting down

The trap state is left (return to normal operation) after TRPF has become 0 again when a zero-match of T12 (while counting up) is detected (synchronization to T12).
The trap state is left (return to normal operation) after TRPF has become 0 again when a zero-match of T13 is detected (synchronization to T13).
The trap state is left (return to normal operation) immediately after TRPF has become 0 again without any synchronization to T12 or T13.
The trap state is left (return to normal operation) after TRPF has become 0 again when a zero-match of T12 (while counting up) is detected (synchronization to T12).
The trap state is left (return to normal operation) after TRPF has become 0 again when a zero-match of T13 is detected (synchronization to T13).
The trap state is left (return to normal operation) immediately after TRPF has become 0 again without any synchronization to T12 or T13.
Automatic Mode: Bit TRPF is cleared by HW if the trap input condition is no longer valid.
Manual Mode: Bit TRPF stays 0 after the trap input condition is no longer valid. It has to be cleared by SW by writing ISR.RTRPF=1.
The trap functionality of the corresponding output signal is disabled. The output state is independent from bit IS.TRPS.
The trap functionality of the corresponding output signal is enabled. The output state is set to the passive while IS.TRPS=1.

bitfield.name: TRPEN13
bitfield.description: Trap Enable Control for Timer T13

value.description: The trap functionality for output COUT63 is disabled. The output state is independent from bit IS.TRPS.
The trap functionality for output COUT63 is enabled. The output state is set to the passive while IS.TRPS=1.
The CCU6 trap functionality based on the input CTRAP is disabled. A CCU6 trap can only be generated by SW by setting bit TRPF.
The CCU6 trap functionality based on the input CTRAP is enabled. A CCU6 trap can be generated by SW by setting bit TRPF or by CTRAP=0.

Single-input scan is selected. The trigger option is disabled (no automatic trigger of more conversions of CHx).

Multi-input scan is selected. The trigger option is enabled leading to an automatic scan through the externally connected multiplexer inputs by automatically triggering additional conversions of CHx until EMUX=0.
The scan mode is disabled. Bit field EMUX is updated by bit field SETEMUX at the beginning of a conversion of the selected channel. If bit EMUX is changed, the value of EMSAMPLE is applied.

The scan mode is enabled. Bit field EMUX is decremented by 1 for each conversion of the selected channel. After reaching 0, bit field EMUX is updated by bit field SETEMUX. The value of EMSAMPLE is always applied for the selected channel. It is recommended to write the start value of the first scan sequence to SETEMUX while EMUXEN=0.
The external multiplexer control by HW is disabled. Bit field EMUX is immediately updated under SW control by writing to SETEMUX. The settings of SCANEN and TROEN are ignored.
The external multiplexer control is enabled. The update of EMUX is under HW control respecting the conversion timings.

value.description: ADCy_SR0 is selected.
ADCy_SR1 is selected.
ADCy_SR7 is selected.
The multiplexer test mode is disabled. The analog input CH7 can be used for normal measurements.

The multiplexer test mode is enabled. The analog input CH7 is internally connected to ground via voltage divider based on an additional resistor. Please refer to the AC/DC chapter for the value of the grounding resistor and its current capability.
Start-up calibration can be started.
Start-up calibration has been started.
The automatic post calibration is enabled.
The automatic post calibration is disabled.
The multiplexer test mode for the selected input channel is disabled. This analog input can be used for normal measurements.
The multiplexer test mode for the selected input channel is enabled. This analog input is internally connected to ground via voltage divider based on an additional resistor.

bitfield.name: DIVA
bitfield.description: Divider Factor for Analog Internal Clock

value.description: fADCI = fADC / 4
fADCI = fADC / 4.
fADCI = fADC / 4..
fADCI = fADC / 4...
fADCI = fADC / 4....
fADCI = fADC / 5
fADCI = fADC / 6
fADCI = fADC / 7
fADCI = fADC / 63

bitfield.name: DIVD
bitfield.description: Divider Factor for Digital Arbiter Clock

value.description: fADCD = fADC
fADCD = fADC / 2
fADCD = fADC / 3
fADCD = fADC / 4
An arbitration round contains 4 arbitration slots (tARB=4/fADCD).
An arbitration round contains 8 arbitration slots (tARB=8/fADCD).
An arbitration round contains 16 arbitration slots (tARB=16/fADCD).
An arbitration round contains 20 arbitration slots (tARB=20/fADCD).
The arbiter runs permanently. This setting has to be chosen in a synchronization slave (see ) and for equidistant sampling using the signal ARBCNT (see ).

The arbiter only runs if at least one conversion request of an enabled request source is pending. This setting leads to a reproducible latency from an incoming request to the conversion start if the converter is idle. Synchronized conversions are not supported.
The analog part is idle.
A conversion is currently active.
The analog part is not in the sampling phase.
The analog part is in the sampling phase.
The analog part is not in the calibration phase.
The analog part is in the calibration phase.

The analog part is switched off and conversions are not possible. To achieve a minimal power consumption, the internal analog circuitry is in its power-down state and the generation of fADCI and fADCD is stopped (counters set to an initial value). Furthermore, the arbiter finishes its current arbitration round (if running) and then remains in the idle state.
reserved, do not use
reserved, do not use.
The analog part of the ADC module is switched on and conversions are possible.

There is no synchronous conversion running (either there is no conversion currently running or a parallel conversion has not been requested). A running conversion can be cancelled and repeated in case of a new incoming conversion request with higher priority.

A synchronous conversion is running. This conversion can not be cancelled while running. Higher priority requests can trigger conversions only after the end of the currently running synchronous conversion.
The channel requested by the request source of arbitration slot 0 is (has been) converted.
The channel requested by the request source of arbitration slot 1 is (has been) converted.
The channel requested by the request source of arbitration slot 6 is (has been) converted.
The channel requested by a synchronous injection is (has been) converted.
The result is 10 bits wide.
The result is 12 bits wide.
The result is 8 bits wide.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
No action
The service request output SRx of the ADC kernel becomes activated.
The acknowledge is not activated, because at least one of the module kernels is in a transition phase.
The acknowledge is activated, because all module kernels have reached the requested state.
A suspend mode is not requested and bit field NOMCFG defines the ADC kernel mode.
A suspend mode is requested and bit field SUMCFG defines the ADC kernel mode.
Run mode 0 is selected.
Run mode 1 is selected.
Stop mode 0 is selected.
Stop mode 1 is selected.
The bit field NOMCFG is not changed.
The bit field NOMCFG is updated with the written value.
The bit field SUMCFG is not changed.
The bit field SUMCFG is updated with the written value.
The request is discarded after the conversion start.
The request is refilled into the queue after the conversion start.
The request source interrupt generation is disabled.
The request source interrupt generation is enabled.
The request handler does not wait for a trigger event.
The request handler waits for a trigger event.
The queue entry is not valid and does not lead to a conversion request.
The queue entry is valid and leads to a conversion request.
The backup register does not contain a valid entry.
The backup register contains a valid entry. It will be requested before a valid entry in queue register 0 will be requested.
The content of this queue entry is not entered again in QINRx when the related conversion is started.
The content of this queue entry is automatically entered again in QINRx when the related conversion is started.
A request source event interrupt is not generated if the related conversion is finished.
A request source event interrupt is generated if the related conversion is finished.
A valid queue entry immediately leads to a conversion request.
A valid queue entry waits for a trigger event to occur before issuing a conversion request.
The request source does not issue conversion requests.
The request source issues conversion requests if a valid conversion request is pending in the queue 0 register or in the backup register.
The request source issues conversion requests if a valid conversion request is pending in the queue 0 register or in the backup register and the selected gating signal REQGTx=1.

The external trigger is enabled and a trigger event is generated if the selected edge is detected at the selected trigger input signal for REQTRx.
No action.

The next pending valid queue entry in the sequence and the event flag EV are cleared. If there is a valid entry in the queue backup register (QBURx.V=1), this entry is cleared, otherwise the entry in queue register 0 is cleared.
No action.
A trigger event is generated by SW. If the a valid entry in the request source waits for a trigger event, a conversion request is started.
No action.
All entries in the queue (including the backup stage) and the event flag EV are cleared. The queue contains no more valid entry.
No action.
Bit EV is cleared.
